    • Constructor Detail

      • Builder

        public Builder()
        Creates a builder for a front-end DPE. The front-end DPE contains the registration service used by the orchestrators to find running worker DPEs and engines.

        A front-end DPE is also a worker DPE that can run user engines, so it is recommended to run a front-end when using ERSAP on a local box. In multi-node ERSAP distributions it is mostly used a discovery and gateway for workers DPEs.

      • Builder

        public Builder​(java.lang.String frontEndHost)
        Creates a builder for a worker DPE. A worker DPE mainly runs user engines as part of a cloud of DPEs. All worker DPEs must register with the main front-end DPE.

        When running ERSAP on single node, a front-end DPE must be used instead of a worker DPE.

        Parameters:
        frontEndHost - the host address of the front-end

      • Builder

        public Builder​(java.lang.String frontEndHost,
               int frontEndPort)
        Creates a builder for a worker DPE. A worker DPE mainly runs user engines as part of a cloud of DPEs. All worker DPEs must register with the main front-end DPE.

        When running ERSAP on single node, a front-end DPE must be used instead of a worker DPE.

        Parameters:
        frontEndHost - the host address of the front-end
        frontEndPort - the port number of the front-end
